item.title: Generative AI Newsletter - July 3, 2024
item.content:encoded:
Hello QuinStreet Team,

Welcome to this week's edition of QuinStreet’s Generative AI Newsletter. I’m excited to bring you the latest updates and trends shaping the AI landscape. From insightful industry reports to groundbreaking tool releases, here's a comprehensive overview of the significant AI developments from the past few weeks.

Also, the QuinStreet Generative AI Database site is currently in beta and should be accurate/up to date sometime next week: https://blahdude.github.io/qs-research/

Figma Config

  • AI Beta Exploration: Figma wrapped up its Config conference last week, unveiling various AI tools which they will slowly release to users throughout the year. Users can now explore the Figma AI Beta. Join the beta
  • Controversial Feature: Figma's "Make Design" AI tool faced criticism for producing outputs similar to Apple’s weather app, leading to its removal. Learn more
  • Model Training: Figma users have until August 15th to decide on the usage of their designs for AI training. Learn more

New Tools and Updates

  • Claude 3.5 Sonnett: New Anthropic model sets new benchmarks for graduate level reasoning, undergraduate level knowledge, and coding proficiency. Try it out
  • ChatGPT App: Desktop ChatGPT app now available to all MacOS users! Find out more
  • Gemini 1.5 Pro: The waitlist is now open for developers to access the 2M token context. Learn more
  • Gemini Chrome Update: can now run in Chrome locally/offline. Example Opt in here: Google Form
  • Runway Gen-3 Alpha: The most powerful text-to-video model yet has been released. Check it out
  • MISed: A new tool for conversing with meeting transcripts, eliminating the need to read entire transcripts or recordings. Discover more
  • Stanford Course: Stanford professor Andrej Karpathy released a massive course to build AI storytellers using LLM. Designed to provide a deep understanding of AI, LLMs, and deep learning. Find Course Here

Industry Insights

  • A recent report featuring insights from over 700 tech leaders has shed light on the current state of AI and its use cases. Here are some key takeaways:
    • Perception of AI: 50.3% of tech leaders believe AI is overrated.
    • Investment Gaps: 40.5% of leadership feels they haven't invested sufficiently in AI.
    • Daily Use: On average, 56.4% use AI copilots daily, with this figure rising to 72% in smaller companies.
    • Adoption Rates: AI adoption varies across roles, with designers at 39%, project managers at 68%, and engineers at 62.5%.
    • Productivity Boost: 85% of respondents report increased productivity due to AI.
    • ChatGPT Usage: 76.7% of the leaders use ChatGPT regularly.
  • For more detailed insights, read the full report.

Industry Developments

  • Apple and AI Deals: Apple is exploring AI deals beyond OpenAI, including with Meta and Google. More details
  • Leading AI Models: ChatGPT-4o and Claude 3.5 Sonnett are excelling in image analysis. Find out more
  • AI Safety Benchmarking: Anthropic introduced a new benchmarking program for LLM safety. Learn about it
  • AI-Generated Lawsuits: The rise of AI-generated lawsuits is here. Read more

Global Developments

  • China's AI Patent Surge: China has filed six times more generative AI patents than the US, showcasing diverse applications across industries. Read the report

New Models and Datasets on Hugging Face

  • Hugging Face is an open-source AI model platform that streamlines AI implementation
    • MARS5: A cutting-edge speech model capable of generating diverse prosody with just 5 seconds of audio and a text snippet. Explore MARS5
      • Use cases include call centers, ads, and voice overs.
    • PersonaHub: A versatile dataset for training models on synthetic data tailored for various personas. Learn more
      • Use cases include chatbots, content creation, and analytics.

Investment and Startup News

  • For AI enthusiasts, here are the latest funding rounds from the past week. Keeping track of these updates is an excellent way to identify the newest and most innovative projects in the AI space.
    • Stability AI raised a new funding round and appointed Prem Akkaraju as CEO. Learn More
    • Orby AI secured $30 million to develop extensive action models. Learn More
    • Day.ai garnered $4 million from Sequoia for an AI-centric CRM. Learn More
    • Axelera raised $68 million for edge AI chip development. Learn More
    • Etched obtained $120 million for transformer-specialized chips. Learn More
    • Emergence acquired $97.2 million for its agent platform. Learn More
    • EvolutionaryScale secured $142 million for a new AI model in protein discovery. Learn More
    • Kleiner Perkins raised $2 billion for startups leveraging generative AI. Learn More
    • AI e-commerce platform Daydream secured $50 million in new funding. Learn More
    • illumex raised $13 million for data governance in generative AI. Learn More
    • SoftBank invested in Perplexity at a $3 billion valuation. Learn More
    • Hebbia raised $100 million in Series B funding for document search. Learn More
    • Oracle announced new in-database LLM capabilities. Learn More
    • SoftBank partnered with Tempus to invest in healthcare AI. Learn More
    • Andrew Ng is raising $120 million for his next AI fund. Learn More
    • Creatio raised $200 million for its AI low-code platform. Learn More
    • Nubank acquired AI banking platform Hyperplane. Learn More
    • Dappier raised $2 million for an LLM content marketplace. Learn More
    • Substrate obtained $8 million for its modular AI platform. Learn More

Stay tuned for more updates and detailed insights into the evolving world of AI.

Best regards,

Oliver Camp
